abstract.p: Hyundai Motor Co, South Korea, says it has been negotiating with DaimlerChrysler AG about making joint bid for the ailing Daewoo Motor Co; photo (S)

block.p: South Korea's largest carmaker, the Hyundai Motor Company, said it had been negotiating with DaimlerChrysler A.G. about making a joint bid for the ailing Daewoo Motor Company. For weeks, rumors have been circulating about a joint bid, which could reduce the South Korean government's distaste at the prospect that the nation's largest carmaker will swallow its only rival. ''They are looking positively into the matter,'' said Chung Mong Koo, chairman of Hyundai Motor, referring to DaimlerChrysler. General Motors, Ford and Fiat of Italy have also submitted letters of interest to buy Daewoo Motor.

''They are looking positively into the matter,'' said Chung Mong Koo, chairman of Hyundai Motor, referring to DaimlerChrysler. General Motors, Ford and Fiat of Italy have also submitted letters of interest to buy Daewoo Motor.
